author: __flcl
content: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/experimental/blob-extension.md#specification-2 says BlobsBundleV1 may return -32001: Unknown payload, the same error message but different number are used by engine_getPayload*  -38001: Unknown payload. Is it by purpose to have these codes different?

author: jessepollak
content:
just saw this update on Deneb in from ACDC:

> Prysm: Working on gossip features, blocks by range, and blocks by route. Does not yet have backfilling functionality. Ready to pair and interop with other clients on testnets.
> 
> Lighthouse: Working on single blob lookups and pre-processing functionality. Gearing up to releasing a testable client version that could run on a testnet.
> 
> Lodestar: Ready to pair and interop with other clients on testnets.
> 
> Teku: In a building phase. Working on the API for signing, cashing, gossiping, and deconstructing bundles from blobs and blocks. Not ready to interop with other clients at the moment.

honestly, incredible progress. way to go everyone!

author: inphi
content: I don't think the codes should be different. Unless <@203220829473996800> you had a particular reason for using a different code?

author: roberto.bayardo
content: I am now more convinced we should also have dataGasPrice as a separate field, which is consistent with the fact that effectiveGasPrice is in the receipt already. This way from a receipt you can calculate total gas cost easily (effectiveGasPrice * gasUsed) + (dataGasPrice * dataGasUsed) that should be forward compatible with any fee parameter changes.

author: acolytec3
content: Makes sense to me and will add to the PR.  Thanks for pointing this out

author: protolambda
content: nice catch! The error code used for "Unknown Payload" changed mid last year. The 4844 spec still uses the old code. See https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/4a4d531052324fb26c32868d26aa5f1e085a98ff and https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/214/files

author: protolambda
content: I'll make a PR to update it
